intro: Tecoma australis, commonly known as the golden trumpet or yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that produces showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and long, pendulous inflorescences. Tecoma australis thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological value.
